We need your help as we navigate the logistics of reopening school in September. Please consider providing us with valuable survey information that will help with our decision making.

We're using a new tool called Thoughtexchange to gather your input. Thoughtexchange keeps confidential who shared each thought and who assigned what ratings. You can rate as many thoughts as you'd like before moving on to Discover where you can see all the thoughts sorted by the average star rating.

The following information is related to the student drop-off of school property and student pick- up of personal property on Tuesday, June 16, 2020, to close out the 2019-2020 school year. We have scheduled specific times to help with the logistics of collecting and distributing items. If you have children in multiple grade levels you can select one time. We will try to be as flexible as possible to work around individual schedules.

Parents will drop off Chromebooks, iPads, textbooks, Library books, uniforms, and instruments in the North gymnasium parking lot. Parents will continue from the North gymnasium parking lot to the bus loop toward the main entrance near the cafeteria to pick up any student items that may have been left in March.

Time Grade Levels
8:00 am- 9:00 am K-4
9:00 am- 10:00 am 5-8
10:00 am- 11:00 am 9-12

We appreciate the continued community support during this difficult time. We hope everyone has a relaxing summer as we recharge for the Fall of 2020.

Take care and be safe.

CPCS Staff

Sealed ballot envelopes must be signed in order to be counted. These envelopes will remain sealed until after 5pm June 16th. We will share any relevant additional details once the Executive Order is released.
